    • Method Detail

      • setChildren

        public void setChildren(@NonNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,DecisionTree> children)
        Attach children to this node. Trying to attach children to a node which already has children will result in an IllegalStateException.
        Parameters:
        children - a map of branch labels to child nodes
        See Also:
        getBranchLabel()

      • getColumnName

        public java.lang.String getColumnName()
        Returns:
        the name of the column this node is splitting on.
        See Also:
        getColumnIndex()

      • getColumnIndex

        public int getColumnIndex()
        Each node in the decision tree splits the data set lines into two or more partitions based on some splitting criteria applied to a certain column.

        The same column can be encountered multiple times when traversing the tree from root to leaf, but this should only happen if the column has continuous values.

        Returns:
        the index of the column this node is splitting on.

      • getBranchLabel

        public @Nullable java.lang.String getBranchLabel()
        The partiotion label that was used to arrive at this node from its parent.

        Example 1: if a node splits on column A with continous values between 10 and 100, it might have two children with branch labels "<40" and ">=40".

        Example 2: a node that splits on column B with three possible values, `a`, `b`, `c`, it might have three children, whose branch labels will be "a", "b", "c" respectively

        Returns:
        this node's branch label, or null if it is the root node

      • getParent

        public @Nullable DecisionTree getParent()
        Returns:
        this node's parent node, or null if it is the root node

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<DecisionTree> getChildren()
        Returns:
        a list of 0 or more child nodes

      • getPopulation

        public TrainingData getPopulation()
        Get the training set partition that was matched into this node.
